translation.en: I wasn't trying to escape.
No, please.
Don't. Don't.
I don't want to die.
Oh, yeah. Yeah, I'll make you clean.
I'm sorry.
I didn't-- I didn't mean to....
Hey, sis.
-Time is it? -Just after 8.
-You want me to make coffee? -No, I gotta go. I'll call you later.
translation.ja: コーヒーは？ いいよ　もう出かける

translation.en: You sure there's nothing I can do?
Angie, everything's gonna be fine. Just go back to sleep.
translation.ja: 万事うまくいくさ だから寝てくれ

translation.en: All right, I'm coming, I'm coming.
translation.ja: 分かった　今 行くよ

translation.en: Ben Carson.
Lorenzo Sapelli. I've been waiting for you. Come on in.
translation.ja: ロレンゾ･サペッリだ 待ってたぞ 入って

translation.en: -How long you been working here? -All together...
translation.ja: 何年 警備を？ 全部で？

translation.en: ...15 years.
You were here for the fire?
Devastating.
Entire building up in flames.
translation.ja: 建物が炎にのみこまれた

translation.en: It's been five years since the fire.
They're still in a legal battle with the insurance companies.
translation.ja: まだ保険会社と 裁判で争ってる

translation.en: Even cleaning up this mess is impossible.
translation.ja: 後片付けもできん状況だ

translation.en: I've given up faith about reopening, and besides...
translation.ja: もうデパートは再開できん

translation.en: ...who'd ever want to shop here after everything that's happened?
translation.ja: 客も こんな店は敬遠するさ

translation.en: You know, the Meredith family acquired this building...
translation.ja: ここは 聖マタイ病院だったが―

translation.en: ...after St. Matthew's Hospital closed in 1952.
translation.ja: 52年の閉鎖後に メレディス家が買収した

translation.en: It was the very first Mayflower to open on the East Coast.
translation.ja: 東海岸における メイフラワーの１号店だ

translation.en: The company wants us to patrol the premises every couple of hours.
translation.ja: パトロールは 原則２時間おきだが―

translation.en: But I do my rounds every three, that's more than enough.
translation.ja: 俺は３時間おきに回ってる

translation.en: Anyway, you'll see, not too much going on. It's pretty calm around here.
translation.ja: 今に分かるが― 大した騒ぎもなく 静かなもんだ

translation.en: Well, there you go.
Perfume and Cosmetics Department, what's left of it anyway.
translation.ja: 香水と化粧品売り場の残骸(ざんがい)だ

translation.en: Thank God you didn't show up any later. This place gives me the creeps at night.
translation.ja: 昼間でよかった 夜は気味が悪くて

translation.en: No electricity.
All these mirrors.
Best to keep your eyes away from them.
translation.ja: 鏡を覗(のぞ)くのはよせ

translation.en: You polish them?
-I'm sorry? -The mirrors, they're so clean.
translation.ja: 何だって？ 鏡がきれいだ

translation.en: No, that's Gary. Gary Lewis.
translation.ja: ルイスが鏡を磨いてた

translation.en: Fella who was working here before you.
He was completely obsessed with these damn mirrors.
translation.ja: 奴は鏡に取り憑(つ)かれてた

translation.en: Spent the entire night cleaning them.
How long has it been since you left the N.Y.P.D.?
About a year.
I know it's none of my business, but...
translation.ja: 俺の知ったことじゃないが―

translation.en: ...why did you resign from the force?
You used to be a detective, is that correct?
translation.ja: あんた 刑事だったんだろ？

translation.en: Yeah.
I'm sorry.
I always been too curious.
It's all right.
There was a pretty big team working here before the fire.
translation.ja: 火事の前は 警備員が大勢いた

translation.en: You know, when you stop to think...
...of all the department stores in New York... ...this one was the most beautiful, the most luxurious.
translation.ja: ＮＹの中でも ひときわ美しく豪華だった

translation.en: I mean, it breaks your heart, it really does.
Well, here you go.
This is where you'll be spending most of your time.
translation.ja: 大半は ここで過ごす

translation.en: At least you got electricity in here.
It's warm, it's nice.
You've even got a TV.
-Hello. -Hey, Rosa. How are you doing?
I'm fine. Let me help you.
translation.ja: ええ　持ちましょう

translation.en: -Where are the kids? -Upstairs with Señor Ben.
translation.ja: 子供たちは？ ２階でセニョール･ベンと

translation.en: So, everybody at my school thinks this boy named Eamon...
translation.ja: 学校のみんなは イーモンって男の子が―

translation.en: ...which is like one of my best friends, which is a boy, likes me.
translation.ja: 学校のみんなは イーモンって男の子が― 私に夢中だって 思っちゃってるの

translation.en: And this girl named Christiana, who liked him, is just now gossiping.
translation.ja: ウワサの元は 彼を好きだった女の子よ

translation.en: You want me to talk to Mrs. Ward?
She'll make them want to wrap me up in toilet paper for Halloween.
translation.ja: 告げ口したら みんなにイジメられる

translation.en: Look, Mommy. Look what Daddy got me.
translation.ja: ママ　パパがくれたの

translation.en: It looks great. You'll have to show me how it works later.
translation.ja: 素敵な車ね あとでよく見せて

translation.en: It's so fast, Mommy.
Ben? Can I talk to you?
translation.ja: ベン ちょっといい？

translation.en: Yeah.
You two. You need to finish homework. You need to get ready for your bath.
translation.ja: デイジーは宿題 マイケルはお風呂だ

translation.en: -No fooling around, let's go. -Okay, let's go, Michael.
Hey. Come here.
Happy, happy birthday.
-Thanks, Dad. -Yeah.
-What is this? -What?
I've asked you not to drop by without calling.
translation.ja: 来るときは電話するって

translation.en: You won't answer my calls.
-I don't want to argue. -I don't want to argue.
translation.ja: やめて 俺の電話に出ないのなら…

translation.en: If you're not gonna answer my calls, what--?
translation.ja: 俺の電話に出ないのなら…

translation.en: I haven't had a drink for three months. Since you won't answer, how would you know?
translation.ja: もう３ヵ月以上も 禁酒してるんだ

translation.en: I don't want to know.
What I want is for you to respect my needs.
translation.ja: こちらの条件は守って

translation.en: I'm doing everything I can to respect your needs.
translation.ja: 俺も必死で頑張ってる

translation.en: I haven't had a drink.
I got a new job to hold me over till I'm reinstated.
translation.ja: 復職までの仕事も見つけた

translation.en: I'm doing everything I can to get back on my feet again.
translation.ja: 社会復帰の努力をしてる

translation.en: What?
You don't think people can change?
We're not talking about people. We're talking about you.
translation.ja: 人間じゃなくて あなたの話よ

translation.en: Amy, I killed a man.
You don't just get over that.
I needed time. I needed you.
translation.ja: 時間と君が必要だった

translation.en: -I was right here. -Yeah. Judging me like everybody else.
translation.ja: ここにいたわ 俺を裁いてた

translation.en: How dare you say that to me.
I was the only one at the precinct who defended you.
How many times did I chase reporters off our front lawn?
translation.ja: 何度 リポーターを 追い払ったか

translation.en: How can you say that to me?
I've always been in your corner. I've been the only one who believed in you.
translation.ja: あなたを信じて 支えてきたのに

translation.en: You're fucking unbelievable!
Please, I didn't come here to fight.
Look, I'm sorry that I came over without calling.
translation.ja: 電話もせずに 訪ねて悪かった

translation.en: I just wanted to see them.
-But we have to set up some rules. -What fucking rules?
translation.ja: ルールが必要よ ルールだと？

translation.en: Come on, Amy, just tell me what rules I need to follow... ...so I can see my son on his birthday!
translation.ja: 息子の誕生日を祝うのに どんなルールが必要なんだ？

translation.en: Look at yourself.
This is exactly what I'm talking about.
I don't know how you're going to be from one moment to the next.
translation.ja: あなたは情緒不安定よ

translation.en: When I get around you, I get... ...nervous.
translation.ja: こうして君といると 神経質になるんだ

translation.en: Because I am so scared that I am losing you.
translation.ja: 君を失う不安にかられて―

translation.en: And I screw everything up.
I've missed you so much.
I miss you too.
Amy, we deserve another chance.
translation.ja: エイミー　やり直そう

translation.en: I know how much I love you, and I know somewhere inside there... ...you love me too.
translation.ja: 君を愛してる 君も俺を愛してるはずだ

translation.en: Please.
I can't do this.
I can't do this, Ben.
Holy shit.
What the hell?
You should stop taking those pills.
How are you doing today?
I'm fine. I feel a lot better. I'm leaving in a couple of minutes.
translation.ja: だいぶいいよ すぐに出る

translation.en: -Are you sure you're all right? -Please, not you.
translation.ja: 本当に大丈夫？ もう聞くな

translation.en: Okay. I'm just saying, you can talk to me if you want.
translation.ja: 心配事があるなら話してよ

translation.en: I'm your little sister.
-It's that new job, isn't it? -Yeah, well, I need that new job.
translation.ja: 仕事のこと？ ああ　仕事は必要だ

translation.en: I can't take care of Amy, and the kids, and myself on my pension.
translation.ja: 年金だけじゃ 妻や子供は養えない

translation.en: I'm not gonna sleep on your couch for the rest of my life.
translation.ja: 一生 居候(いそうろう)もできないし

translation.en: Okay, well, maybe you get a daytime job, a regular job.
translation.ja: それなら― ９時５時の 定職を探せばいいわ

translation.en: It's not that simple.
Well, you should think about it.
Ben! What happened?
Just leave me alone.
Please, just leave me alone!
Angie, get out of here! Now!
What is happening to you, Ben?
Pull yourself together.
Help!
Gary Lewis.
Esseker.
Where are you?
I want to help you, but I need to know where you are!
translation.ja: 助けるから どこか教えろ

translation.en: I'm coming!
Anybody here?
Is anybody in here?
Fuck this place.
Mom! Mom! Mom!
Michael? Are you okay? What's happening?
translation.ja: マイケル 大丈夫？　何があったの？

translation.en: Michael. What's the matter, sweetie?
translation.ja: マイケル いったいどうしたの？

translation.en: -There's a lady screaming. -Where?
There, in the mirror.
In the mirror?
I don't see anybody but you and I in the mirror.
-You just had a nightmare, sweetie. -Okay.
Sometimes they can feel really real, but they're not, all right?
translation.ja: 本物みたいでも夢なのよ

translation.en: -Okay. -Okay, let's go back to sleep.
Come on. In you go.
translation.ja: さあ　布団に入って

translation.en: I'm right around the corner, all right?
Love you.
I love you too, sweetie.
Can you leave the door open?
Sure, sweetheart.
You two go back to sleep, okay?
The 42-year old is expected to go on trial this month for allegedly...
translation.ja: 42歳の男が 今月 公判を迎えます

translation.en: ...sexually assaulting a former co-worker in her apartment...
translation.ja: 被告はハロウィーンの夜に―

translation.en: ...for 13 hours on Halloween night in 2005.
translation.ja: 元同僚を13時間にわたり 性的暴行

translation.en: Braunstein's lawyer says his client was mentally ill at the time.
translation.ja: 弁護士は 心神喪失を主張しています

translation.en: The feds say they'll seek the death penalty against a former mob boss...
translation.ja: 連邦捜査局が マフィアのボスに―

translation.en: ...accused of ordering a hit on a rival.
translation.ja: 死刑を求刑しています

translation.en: The trial of Vincent "Vinny Gorgeous"....
translation.ja: 通称ヴィニーの裁判が…

translation.en: I swear to you, I could feel my flesh burning. I couldn't breathe. It was like my lungs were full of smoke.
translation.ja: 本当に体が焼けるようで 煙で息もできなかった

translation.en: It was like a nightmare but I was awake. I know I was awake.
translation.ja: 夢のようだが 俺は絶対に起きてた

translation.en: You think I'm crazy, don't you?
I don't know what to think. I think you're going through...
translation.ja: 答えに困るわ 兄さんは試練にあって ストレスもある

translation.en: ...a hard time in your life. You're under a lot of stress.
translation.ja: 兄さんは試練にあって ストレスもある

translation.en: You've been having those nightmares since the shooting.
translation.ja: 誤射事件から夢もみてるし

translation.en: You know it wasn't your fault.
They're everywhere.
-What are you talking about? -The fucking mirrors, they are everywhere.
translation.ja: 何の話？ 鏡がそこら中にある

translation.en: In the department store, on the corner of every street...
translation.ja: デパートにも街角にも ビルにもある

translation.en: ...in the window of every building in this city. I f--
translation.ja: デパートにも街角にも ビルにもある 感じるんだ

translation.en: I feel like I'm not the one looking into the mirrors... ...but they're looking back at me.
translation.ja: 鏡の中から 誰かが俺を見てるって

translation.en: There's no one looking back at you through the mirrors.
You're obviously.... You're still conflicted about what happened.
translation.ja: まだあの事件の 後遺症が残ってるのよ

translation.en: Maybe you need to talk to someone.
A professional. Someone....
Mirrors are just glass and silver, Ben, that's it. There's nothing behind them.
translation.ja: 鏡なんて銀とガラスの板よ 誰も隠れてないわ

translation.en: Will you please go get some sleep, okay?
translation.ja: お願いだから睡眠をとって

translation.en: I love you.
Coming!
Hold on!
-Mr. Carson? -Yeah.
You want to sign here, please?
You have a good day, sir.
Holy shit.
Lorenzo, I need to talk to you.
translation.ja: ロレンゾ　話がある

translation.en: I just had the craziest day here. Your ex-colleagues came to pay us a visit.
translation.ja: 全くたまげたよ 警官が訪ねてきた

translation.en: What are you talking about?
You know Gary, the guy who was working here before you?
translation.ja: あんたの前任者のルイスだが

translation.en: Cops found him dead in a subway station in Harlem.
translation.ja: ハーレムの駅で 死体が見つかった

translation.en: I never liked him too much, but poor guy, he didn't deserve to go like that.
translation.ja: 変な奴だったが これじゃ気の毒だ

translation.en: -Did they tell you the cause of death? -What?
-Did they tell you how he died? -No, they wouldn't tell me.
translation.ja: 死んだ原因だ 教えてくれなかった

translation.en: Mrs. Sapelli is waiting for me at home. I gotta go.
translation.ja: じゃ女房が待ってるから

translation.en: By the way, about that leak in the basement...
...they're sending someone over to work on that, beginning of next week.
translation.ja: 来週 人が来て 修理するそうだ

translation.en: We have a white male, 50 years of age, name unknown.
translation.ja: 遺体は50歳前後の白人男性 氏名不詳

translation.en: Following the completion of the external examination...
...the body was washed and lightly dried.
A Y-incision was made from the bilateral clavicular joints...
translation.ja: Ｙ字切開は両側の鎖骨の 関節部から―

translation.en: ...to the xiphoid process.
-The tissue was waterlogged-- -Amy.
translation.ja: 組織は湿り… エイミー

translation.en: Yes, what is it?
There's someone in the lobby for you. It sounds urgent.
translation.ja: ロビーにお客よ　急用だって

translation.en: Ben. What's happening? What are you doing here?
Thanks for seeing me. Look, I need to ask you a favor.
translation.ja: すまない　君に頼みがある

translation.en: -I'm in the middle of work. -I know.
Twenty minutes. Yesterday morning you picked up a body.
translation.ja: 20分でいい 昨日の死体だ

translation.en: Gary Lewis. I just need to take a look at him.
translation.ja: Ｇ･ルイス　見せてくれ

translation.en: -Who is he? -A night watchman at the Mayflower.
translation.ja: 誰？ メイフラワーの夜警だった

translation.en: I replaced him.
translation.ja: メイフラワーの夜警だった

translation.en: How do you have his driver's license?
translation.ja: なぜ免許証を？ デパートで見つけた 死因を知りたい

translation.en: I found his wallet in the department store. I just need to know how he died.
translation.ja: デパートで見つけた 死因を知りたい

translation.en: Why do you need to know how he died?
You've been suspended, you're not supposed to be doing any investigations.
translation.ja: 停職中の捜査は禁止よ

translation.en: Listen to me, this is serious.
translation.ja: 頼む　深刻な事態だ

translation.en: There are some very strange things happening over at the Mayflower.
translation.ja: メイフラワーで異常現象が

translation.en: I can't explain what it's--
This guy Gary Lewis sent me a package right before he died.
translation.ja: 彼は死ぬ前に小包を送ってる

translation.en: Thing is, I never met him before.
Inside the package were all these articles on the Mayflower, on the fire.
translation.ja: 中身は火災に関する 新聞記事だ

translation.en: Like he was trying to tell me something, or warn me about something.
translation.ja: 彼は俺に 何かを伝えようとしてた

translation.en: I need to figure this out. Please.
Gary Lewis, Gary Lewis. There he is, B-16.
translation.ja: ゲリー･ルイス… Ｂ16の死体だ ノドを切り裂いてる

translation.en: He slashed his throat.
translation.ja: Ｂ16の死体だ ノドを切り裂いてる

translation.en: Well, there you go, there's your answer. Your man committed suicide.
translation.ja: これが答えよ この男は自殺したの

translation.en: You get a lot of suicide cases with people that slash their own throats?
translation.ja: ノドを切るのが 一般的な自殺方法？

translation.en: I didn't think so. Excuse me.
All I know is, the police are still investigating this one.
translation.ja: まだ警察が捜査中なんで 遺体を保管してる

translation.en: -That's why we still have the body. -What did he use to cut his throat?
translation.ja: まだ警察が捜査中なんで 遺体を保管してる 凶器は？

translation.en: A piece of a mirror.
He probably broke the mirror into pieces... ...so he'd have something to cut himself with.
translation.ja: 鏡をたたき割って その破片で切り裂いた

translation.en: Seven years bad luck.
Esseker.
Are you okay, Ben?
I'm fine.
I'm sorry, excuse me.
I need to see his file.
-What? -I need his file.
What's the problem? I just need to see his file.
Calm down. You're not even supposed to be down here. Now you want to look at somebody's file?
translation.ja: これ以上の 違反を犯せと言うの？

translation.en: Look, I'll be off then. Amy, you know where to find me if you need me.
translation.ja: 僕は失礼する 何かあったら呼んでくれ

translation.en: Yeah. Thanks, Peter. I appreciate it.
translation.ja: 分かったわ　ありがとう

translation.en: I want you to leave now. I'm serious, Ben.
translation.ja: 出てって　私は真剣よ

translation.en: Amy, I'm sorry. I can't leave here until I see that file.
translation.ja: 悪いが記録を見るまでは 帰れない

translation.en: It's important, please.
Please.
Amy.
Come here and look at this picture.
Look at the piece of mirror that Gary Lewis is holding.
And look at it up here in its reflected image in the other mirror.
translation.ja: それが この鏡に映ってる

translation.en: It's full of blood.
Yet in reality, it's perfectly clean. Not a single drop on it.
translation.ja: だが実物には 血が一滴もついてない

translation.en: It's probably the angle from which the photograph was taken. What are you trying to prove?
translation.ja: たぶんアングルのせいよ 何が言いたいの？

translation.en: What if the mirrors are showing us something that's not really happening?
translation.ja: 起きてないことを 映してたら？

translation.en: -What are you talking about? -Just listen to me.
What if the mirrors are reflecting something that's beyond our reality?
translation.ja: もし鏡が現実を超えた 何かを映していたら？

translation.en: What if the mirrors can actually make us do things that we don't want to do? Like making Gary Lewis slit his own throat.
translation.ja: 俺たちを操って 死に追い込むことができる

translation.en: Ben, listen to yourself. You can't talk like that around here.
translation.ja: ここでバカげた話はしないで

translation.en: Don't you want to get reinstated?
Amy, I'm seeing things in the mirrors at work, bad things.
translation.ja: 俺は鏡の中の 恐ろしいものが見える

translation.en: To the point where I can feel what they're showing me.
Ben, you're driving me fucking crazy!
I don't have time for this.
translation.ja: 頭が変になりそう いったいどうしたの？

translation.en: What's wrong with you?
Do you think I'm making this up? Do you think I'm fucking lying?
translation.ja: 俺の作り話だと 思ってるのか？

translation.en: What medication are you taking to stop drinking?
That's a strong drug.
It has a lot of serious side effects. How many pills are you taking a day?
translation.ja: 深刻な副作用があるわ １日何錠を？

translation.en: I'm sorry that I bothered you.
You're right.
Thanks for trying to help.
All right. Where's the body?
translation.ja: ご苦労　遺体はどこだ？

translation.en: -How am I gonna calm down? -Let the detective by. Step over here.
And there's a guy been living with her at her place.
translation.ja: あの子 男と一緒に 暮らしてたよ

translation.en: I saw blood falling from the ceiling. Then she call me.
translation.ja: 見上げたら 天井から血が落ちてきた

translation.en: I want you to ask her, did she hear any noises? Any sounds?
translation.ja: 不審な物音とか叫び声は？

translation.en: -What's going on? -We'll be with you in just a second.
translation.ja: 何事だ？ 入れてくれ　ここの住人だ

translation.en: I live in Apartment 8. I used to be a cop. Just tell me what's going on.
translation.ja: 入れてくれ　ここの住人だ 何があった？

translation.en: -Just a second. -I want to talk to the lead detective!
translation.ja: お待ちを 責任者は？

translation.en: Angela?
Who is the lead detective?
Ben.
Larry, what the hell are you doing here?
-Larry, just tell me what's going on! -Ben, it's not good.
translation.ja: 何があった？ 残念だ

translation.en: Where's Angie?
Where the fuck is my sister? Tell them to let go of me!
translation.ja: 妹はどこにいる？ 会わせろ

translation.en: I can't do that, Ben!
Goddamn it!
The water has obliterated most of the marks.
translation.ja: 水で証拠が洗い流された

translation.en: No sign of struggle or forced entry.
translation.ja: 抵抗の跡は見当たらん

translation.en: And the front door was locked, which means that...
...the person who did this either had keys to the apartment...
translation.ja: つまり犯人は鍵を持ってたか 顔見知りだ

translation.en: -...or it was someone that she knew. -He would've never laid a finger on her.
translation.ja: つまり犯人は鍵を持ってたか 顔見知りだ ベンは可愛がってたわ

translation.en: You know, when their father died, Ben took care of Angela.
translation.ja: 父親の死後 彼が面倒をみてたの

translation.en: She meant the world to him.
Listen, so far, his statement is pretty consistent with the facts, you know?
translation.ja: ベンのアリバイは 裏付けがとれた

translation.en: We checked it out. He showed up to work at 7 p.m.
translation.ja: 午後７時に職場に現れてる

translation.en: The downstairs neighbors said they began to notice the water leakage at around 10.
translation.ja: 階下の住人が 水漏れに気づいたのは10時だ

translation.en: The only strange thing, and this could just be a coincidence...
...is that Ben told the daytime security guard, Lorenzo Sapelli...
translation.ja: 彼が昼間の警備員 ロレンゾ･サペッリに―

translation.en: ...that he was planning on quitting the job. Like he was moving away some place.
translation.ja: 仕事をやめて 引っ越すと言ったことだ

translation.en: He mention anything like that to you?
No.
Lately, communication hasn't been our strong point.
translation.ja: ベンとは会話にならなくて

translation.en: What are you gonna do with him?
Let him go. We got no reason to keep him.
translation.ja: 引き止める理由がない

translation.en: I'm so sorry.
Ben?
Why don't you come home and spend some days with the kids?
translation.ja: うちで子供たちといたら？

translation.en: I can't.
I don't want to put our children in danger.
translation.ja: 危険にさらしたくない

translation.en: She asked me to quit, but I wouldn't.
They came after her.
What are you talking about?
translation.ja: あなた 何の話をしてるの？

translation.en: I've got some things I need to take care of.
Wait, Ben.
-Please. -Amy, let me go.
I don't want you to get in any more trouble. Please, stay out of it.
translation.ja: もう厄介事はたくさん

translation.en: I know who did this.
In that case, you've gotta tell Larry everything.
translation.ja: それならラリーに話して

translation.en: He'll never believe me.
Neither will you.
What do you want?
Please, just tell me.
What do you want from me?
What do you want from me?
translation.ja: 俺に何をしてほしいんだ？

translation.en: Esseker.
Hey. I need you to run a name for me. Esseker.
translation.ja: “エシカー”って名を 調べてほしい

translation.en: Echo, Sierra, Sierra, Echo, Kilo, Echo, Romeo.
translation.ja: 名前のつづりは Ｅ-Ｓ-Ｓ-Ｅ-Ｋ-Ｅ-Ｒだ

translation.en: Did you check online?
I've already done that.
Nothing. IRS and DMV.
translation.ja: 国税庁と陸運局を頼む

translation.en: -Where? -Try New York.
-When? -Last five or six years.
Okay, Ben.
Thanks. Get back to me as soon as you can.
translation.ja: 分かったら知らせてくれ

translation.en: "Mayflower burns, 48 presumed dead."
translation.ja: “メイフラワーで 推定48人死亡”

translation.en: "Berry confesses deadly Mayflower fire."
"Watchman arrested."
"Woman, three children murdered." Come on, Ben, connect the dots.
translation.ja: “妻子４人殺害” 点と点を結べ

translation.en: "Mr. Berry maintains that the mirrors in the store are the ones... ...that brutally killed his wife and three children."
translation.ja: “ベリーは妻子を殺したのは 鏡だと主張”

translation.en: "Mirrors are guilty. Mirrors are guilty."
translation.ja: “鏡がやった　鏡が犯人だ”

translation.en: -Yeah. What did you get? -Hey.
Look, I didn't find anything under that name.
translation.ja: どこにも あの名前はない

translation.en: Do you want me to look outside New York?
No. Hold on. Hold on.
I want you to run another name for me. Berry, Terrence Berry.
translation.ja: 別の名を調べてくれ テレンス･ベリーだ

translation.en: Terrence Berry.
Wait one sec.
I think I got him. You still there?
translation.ja: たぶんこれだ　聞いてるか？

translation.en: Your guy murdered his whole family.
I already know that.
He's dead.
Damn it.
Can you tell me where he was committed before he died?
translation.ja: 彼が収容されてた病院は？

translation.en: When one starts to perceive one's own reflection as a completely separate being...
translation.ja: つまり― 鏡に映る自分を 別人だと認識すると―

translation.en: ...one is suddenly confronted with two entirely separate egos...
translation.ja: 人は全く別々の ２つの自我と―

translation.en: ...two entirely separate worlds that can surface at any given moment.
translation.ja: 全く別々の２つの世界に 直面します

translation.en: A feeling of self-hatred, usually triggered by a psychological shock...
translation.ja: そのショックによる 自己憎悪が原因で―

translation.en: ...can split the personality in two...
translation.ja: 人格が分裂し 同一の人間でありながら―

translation.en: ...hence creating two or more personalities with distinct memories...
translation.ja: 人格が分裂し 同一の人間でありながら― 複数の記憶や性質を持つ 多重人格者になる

translation.en: ...and distinct behavior patterns within the same individual.
translation.ja: 複数の記憶や性質を持つ 多重人格者になる

translation.en: The patient then has the false perception of the existence...
translation.ja: そうして患者は― 世界が２つあると 誤った認識を持ちます

translation.en: ...of two distinct worlds: the real world and the world inside a mirror.
translation.ja: 世界が２つあると 誤った認識を持ちます 現実の世界と鏡の世界

translation.en: These recordings were used in Terrence's trial.
translation.ja: これがベリーのビデオです

translation.en: You'll see they speak for themselves.
Why did you set the department store on fire?
translation.ja: なぜ放火を？ あそこの鏡を破壊するためだ

translation.en: In order to destroy the mirrors.
translation.ja: あそこの鏡を破壊するためだ

translation.en: Only fire can destroy mirrors, isn't that right, doctor?
What made you think you absolutely had to destroy those mirrors, Terrence?
translation.ja: なぜ鏡を 破壊しようと思った？

translation.en: They killed my Helen...
...and my three children.
For what reason? Why would mirrors want to kill your family?
translation.ja: なぜ鏡が君の家族を殺す？

translation.en: -Because I didn't.... -Didn't do what?
translation.ja: 捜さなかった 何を？

translation.en: They asked me to find Esseker.
Oh, my God.
-We all are looking for Esseker. -Amy.
translation.ja: みんな捜してる エイミー

translation.en: Excuse me, I have to go.
Tell me about Esseker, Terrence.
Who is Esseker?
I don't know who Esseker is!
I don't know who Esseker is!
translation.ja: どこの誰だって言うんだ？

translation.en: I don't know!
Mrs. Carson? It's Rosa.
Mr. Ben is here.
He's moving all of the furniture around.
translation.ja: 家中の鏡を外したり 動かしていて

translation.en: Hey. How was school today?
Good.
Good. I'll be right back.
translation.ja: よし　すぐ戻るから

translation.en: Sweetheart, give me a second. I gotta take care of a couple things.
translation.ja: これを片付けてからだ

translation.en: Daddy, what are you doing?
translation.ja: パパ　何をしてるの？

translation.en: Honey, don't look scared. Everything's fine.
translation.ja: 大丈夫　怖くないから

translation.en: I think it looks nicer like this. Don't you?
translation.ja: こっちのほうが素敵だろ

translation.en: Rosa, what's happening?
Take the kids downstairs, right now. Right now!
translation.ja: 子供たちと下に行って

translation.en: What the hell are you doing?
You're gonna have to trust me, this is for your own protection.
Get out of the house, right now.
Are you listening to me?
translation.ja: 子供たちがおびえてるわ

translation.en: You are scaring the kids. If you don't leave immediately...
translation.ja: 子供たちがおびえてるわ 警察を呼ぶわよ 子供にも会わせない

translation.en: ...I'm calling the police and you will never see your kids again.
translation.ja: 警察を呼ぶわよ 子供にも会わせない

translation.en: Amy, I am not crazy. These mirrors are dangerous.
translation.ja: ここの鏡も危険なんだ

translation.en: At first, I thought it was just the ones in the store, but after Angela was killed... ...I realized they can get at you anywhere.
translation.ja: デパートの鏡だけじゃない 奴らは追ってくる

translation.en: I promise I will leave the house, just let me cover these damn mirrors.
translation.ja: 最後まで塗らせてくれ

translation.en: What's wrong with you?
I know what you've been going through hasn't been easy.
But guess what. It hasn't been easy for us either.
translation.ja: でも私たちだって苦しんでる

translation.en: Angela was a part of our lives too, you know that?
translation.ja: アンジェラは家族だったわ

translation.en: It's not fair what you're doing to us, Ben!
translation.ja: それなのにあんまりよ

translation.en: Michael.... He's acting so strange now.
translation.ja: マイケルが― 最近おかしいの

translation.en: He always wants to be alone, he won't talk to me, he's having nightmares.
translation.ja: 口をきかないし 夢にうなされてる

translation.en: Ben, your behavior is rubbing off on him.
translation.ja: あなたの異常な行動のせいよ

translation.en: He is 6 years old, I have to protect him.
I want to show you something.
Ben, let go of me!
You don't want to believe me? Fine, I'll show you.
-What are you doing? -I'll show you!
translation.ja: 何なの？ これを見ろ

translation.en: Are you crazy?!
-Have you gone completely mad? -Just wait, you'll see.
-See what? -You'll see.
See what, Ben? What am I supposed to see?
translation.ja: 何よ？　何が見えるの？

translation.en: It's not happening.
It's not happening.
Amy, I swear to you, at the Mayflower....
I am not lying.
Ben, let's go back inside, okay?
translation.ja: ベン 中に入りましょ

translation.en: Put the gun away.
Listen to me, baby. I want to help you.
translation.ja: あなたを― 助けたいの

translation.en: Tell the kids I'm sorry.
Jesus Christ.
What is this?
Larry, it's me. I need your help again.
translation.ja: ラリー　名簿が欲しい

translation.en: I'm trying to locate the patient-employee manifest for St. Matthew's Hospital.
translation.ja: 聖マタイ病院の 患者と従業員のだ

translation.en: -Where is it? -Where was it? They closed it down.
translation.ja: 所在地は？ すでに閉鎖されてるが メイフラワーの番地だ

translation.en: It was in New York, it's where the Mayflower used to be.
translation.ja: すでに閉鎖されてるが メイフラワーの番地だ

translation.en: The Mayflower? The department store?
Do you know where they'd store records for a hospital... ...that's been closed for over 50 years?
translation.ja: 50年前の名簿の 保管場所を知ってるか？

translation.en: I don't. But I can send someone to city hall to check it out.
translation.ja: 市役所を調べてみるが 公立なら残ってる

translation.en: If it's a public hospital, there'd be a record of it. Tell me exactly what you need.
translation.ja: 市役所を調べてみるが 公立なら残ってる それで誰を？

translation.en: Same thing. I'm looking for a patient or an employee with the name Esseker.
translation.ja: “エシカー”という 患者か従業員だ

translation.en: All right, I'm on it. Give me a couple hours, and Ben, keep your head down.
translation.ja: 分かった　２時間くれ ベン　早まるなよ

translation.en: -Did you get it? -Yeah, I think so.
translation.ja: あったか？ たぶんこれだ

translation.en: It's Anna Esseker.
I didn't really know what you wanted, so I got all the medical files.
translation.ja: 医療記録を持ってきた 助かるよ　ラリー 申し分ない

translation.en: This is perfect, Larry. This is perfect.
translation.ja: 助かるよ　ラリー 申し分ない

translation.en: What happened? Did you get in an accident?
Anna Esseker's file, did you have to go to city hall?
I didn't have to go anywhere. All the files in that place...
translation.ja: 警察にあった 迷宮入りの事件の中に

translation.en: ...were in storage with the cold-case evidence.
translation.ja: 迷宮入りの事件の中に

translation.en: -Why, because of the fire? -No, no, it's before the fire.
translation.ja: 例の火事？ 火事が起きる前の まるで違う事件だ

translation.en: It's a totally different case.
translation.ja: 火事が起きる前の まるで違う事件だ

translation.en: Anna was a patient at St. Matthew's. She was in the psych ward run by a Dr. Kane.
translation.ja: アンナはケーン医師の 精神病棟にいた

translation.en: Now get this, she was only 12 years old when she died.
translation.ja: たった12歳で亡くなってる

translation.en: What?
When the nurses went on their rounds first thing in the morning October 6th, 1952...
translation.ja: 52年10月６日の早朝 看護師が巡回に行くと―

translation.en: ...they discovered that all the patients had left their rooms during the night.
translation.ja: 病室を抜け出した患者たちが ホールにいた

translation.en: They'd all gathered in the main hall. Ben, they were all dead, including the girl.
translation.ja: 病室を抜け出した患者たちが ホールにいた 全員 死体でな　少女もだ

translation.en: Apparently, they killed each other. I mean, it was a slaughterhouse.
translation.ja: 患者同士で殺し合ったらしい

translation.en: That's when they closed the place down. Who knows what really happened?
translation.ja: だから閉鎖されたんだ

translation.en: What about the doctor? Kane?
They arrested him. They found him dead first day of the hearing.
He slashed his wrists with a piece of the cell mirror.
translation.ja: 鏡の破片で手首を切って

translation.en: Thanks for your help.
Good luck.
Jesus.
"October 6th, 1952."
"Anna Esseker is diagnosed with severe schizophrenia, leading...
translation.ja: “アンナは重度の統合失調症”

translation.en: ...to withdrawal from reality, delusional and violent behavior."
"Pennsylvania, August 1951."
They don't match.
Anna Esseker was discharged from St. Matthew's Hospital October 4th.
translation.ja: アンナは10月４日に 退院してる

translation.en: Two days before the massacre.
She's still alive, isn't she?
You almost done, sweetie?
Why is Daddy acting so scared? It's not normal.
translation.ja: なぜパパは怖がるんだろう？ おかしいよ

translation.en: He's way older than me.
translation.ja: 僕より ずっと大人なのに

translation.en: And I'm not acting scared, but he is.
translation.ja: 僕は怖くないけど パパは怖がってる

translation.en: Doesn't make any sense.
Michael? What are you doing?
translation.ja: マイケル 何してるの？

translation.en: Nothing.
Okay, well, we gotta get going, all right?
translation.ja: 急がないと　学校でしょ

translation.en: Amy? Amy, what's wrong?
translation.ja: エイミー どうした？

translation.en: You have to come to the house right now.
I'm so scared.
Amy, what's wrong?
I'm so scared.
-Amy, just tell me what happened. -There's something in the house.
translation.ja: ちゃんと言え 家に何かがいる

translation.en: Something in the mirrors.
I'm on my way. Goddamn it!
translation.ja: すぐ行く チクショウ！

translation.en: Dad? When are you coming back home?
Really soon, sweetheart. Come here.
translation.ja: すぐに戻るよ おいで

translation.en: I love you, Daddy.
I love you, too, sweetheart.
I gotta go.
I'm afraid to stay here.
There's gonna be windows and mirrors wherever you go. Anything that causes a reflection right now is dangerous.
translation.ja: 街中に窓や鏡はある 姿が映るものは危険だ

translation.en: At least inside the house we covered everything. It's the safest place to be.
translation.ja: 家の中は覆い隠したから 一番安全だ

translation.en: Amy, I'm so sorry.
No. It's not your fault. I should've believed you.
translation.ja: あなたは悪くないわ 私こそ疑って

translation.en: Come here.
Ben, you do whatever it takes to end this.
translation.ja: ベン　この悪夢を 終わりにして

translation.en: You hear me?
I will.
I'll be right back.
Yes, sir.
Excuse me. Is this the Esseker farm?
translation.ja: すみません エシカーさん？

translation.en: What is it, Jimmy?
I don't know, Ma. What can I do for you, sir?
translation.ja: 知らないよ ご用件は？

translation.en: I'm looking for Anna, Anna Esseker.
There's a man looking for.... You said "Anna"?
translation.ja: 人を捜してる　アンナ？

translation.en: Yes, Anna Esseker.
An Anna Esseker, Ma.
translation.ja: アンナ･エシカーだって

translation.en: Look, I'm sorry to bother you, I must have the wrong place.
translation.ja: 邪魔して悪かった 家が違うようだ

translation.en: What is it you want with Anna Esseker?
translation.ja: アンナの何が知りたいの？

translation.en: I'm doing a research paper on schizophrenia. I became familiar with Anna Esseker's case.
translation.ja: 統合失調症の論文を書いてて アンナの症例を知った

translation.en: I just wanted to ask her some questions.
translation.ja: 少し質問があるんだが

translation.en: Go tell Grandpa there's a man here who's asking about his sister.
translation.ja: おじいちゃんに 妹のことだって伝えて

translation.en: Thank you.
Grandpa?
You know...
...up to this day, visions of Anna's fits still haunt me at night.
translation.ja: あれから今日まで― アンナの幻影に 苦しめられてる

translation.en: I helped my father fix up this part of the basement especially for her.
translation.ja: 親父を手伝って この地下室を作った アンナのためだ

translation.en: Her fits were too violent.
My mother couldn't take her screams anymore.
We had every priest, doctor, healer, coming in from all over the county.
translation.ja: 国中から聖職者や 医者を呼んで― 診てもらったが 誰も治せやしない

translation.en: But no one could help her.
translation.ja: 診てもらったが 誰も治せやしない

translation.en: Finally, a Dr. Kane from New York...
translation.ja: 結局 ＮＹから ケーン医師が来て―

translation.en: ...answered my parents' cries for help.
translation.ja: 両親の叫びに応えてくれた

translation.en: He rejected the idea of demonic possession... ...said he didn't believe in it.
translation.ja: 彼は悪魔の憑依(ひょうい)説を 完全に否定した

translation.en: He was convinced Anna suffered from a rare form of personality disorder...
translation.ja: アンナは珍しい人格障害で 妹を救えるのは―

translation.en: ...and mirrors could help her.
He wanted Anna under his care, at St. Matthew's.
translation.ja: アンナを入院させ 治療したいと

translation.en: My parents were very poor, but he agreed to cover all the costs of the hospital.
translation.ja: 家が貧しいので― 彼が費用を負担した

translation.en: Where did she go after the hospital?
Don't you know?
She died there with all of Kane's other patients.
translation.ja: 妹は他の患者と死んだ

translation.en: Mr. Esseker, I read the file.
Anna left the hospital two days before the massacre.
translation.ja: 事件の２日前に退院してる

translation.en: Dr. Kane altered the documents so she could disappear.
translation.ja: ケーンが書類を 改ざんしたんだ

translation.en: Where did you get that document?
I need you to tell me where she went after St. Matthew's.
translation.ja: アンナはどこへ行った？

translation.en: She came back and stayed with us for a while.
translation.ja: ここにしばらくいたが…

translation.en: What do you mean for a while?
What happened? Why did she leave?
I don't want to talk about that.
Why did she leave?
Because strange things started to happen in the house.
translation.ja: 奇妙なことが 起こり始めたんだ

translation.en: With Anna?
No, not with Anna anymore. No, she was totally cured.
translation.ja: そうじゃない 妹は完全に治ってた

translation.en: Strange things started to happen with the mirrors, didn't they?
translation.ja: 鏡に異変が起きたのでは？

translation.en: Mr. Esseker, I need to know where Anna is now, it's a matter of life and death.
translation.ja: アンナがどこにいるか 教えてくれ

translation.en: Do not make me threaten you.
We sent her somewhere where mirrors are forbidden.
translation.ja: 妹は鏡が禁じられてる場所に 行った

translation.en: Where the mirrors couldn't find her.
Where? Where?!
St. Augustine's Monastery, on the road to Reedfield.
translation.ja: 聖アウグスティヌス修道院

translation.en: How can I help you?
I'm sorry to disturb you, Sister...
...but I've come to speak with a member of your community. Anna Esseker.
translation.ja: アンナ･エシカーに 会いたいのですが

translation.en: Is she expecting you?
No, not really.
If you're not listed, I cannot help you, sir.
translation.ja: お約束がないと会えません

translation.en: Can you at least tell her that I've come from New York...
translation.ja: 伝えてください 彼女と話したくて ＮＹから来たんです

translation.en: ...to speak with her?
translation.ja: 彼女と話したくて ＮＹから来たんです

translation.en: I work with Dr. Kane from St. Matthew's Hospital.
translation.ja: 聖マタイ病院にいました

translation.en: It's very important, please.
translation.ja: とても重要なことです

translation.en: St. Matthew's closed down in 1952. Who are you?
translation.ja: あの病院は 52年に閉鎖されたわ あなたは？

translation.en: My name is Benjamin Carson.
I work as a night watchman on 6th Avenue in New York City.
translation.ja: ＮＹの６番街で夜警をしてる

translation.en: In the building that used to be St. Matthew's Hospital.
What is it you want, Mr. Carson?
My family is in danger. And what's threatening them is asking for you.
translation.ja: あなたの協力がないと 家族の命が危ない

translation.en: I came all this way to ask you...
translation.ja: なぜ病院にあった鏡は―

translation.en: ...why the mirrors that were left over from St. Matthew's Hospital...
translation.ja: なぜ病院にあった鏡は― 執拗(しつよう)なまでに あなたの行方を捜すんだ？

translation.en: ...are so desperate to find you.
translation.ja: 執拗(しつよう)なまでに あなたの行方を捜すんだ？

translation.en: Please, Miss Esseker.
If you don't help me, I'm gonna lose the most important thing to me in this world...
translation.ja: 助けがないと― この世で一番大切な家族を 失ってしまう

translation.en: ...and that's my family.
translation.ja: この世で一番大切な家族を 失ってしまう

translation.en: Sit down, Mr. Carson.
The mirrors are merely windows on our world.
translation.ja: 鏡は ただ世界を映してるだけ

translation.en: It is not the wish of the mirrors to find me...
translation.ja: 私を捜してるのは鏡ではなく―

translation.en: ...but of what is imprisoned inside them.
translation.ja: 鏡に閉じ込められてるもの

translation.en: What is imprisoned inside them?
At the time...
...that I was at St. Matthew's...
...Dr. Kane's therapy for personality disorders...
translation.ja: ケーン医師の 人格障害の治療は―

translation.en: ...consisted of locking the patient up in a mirrored room...
translation.ja: 患者を鏡張りの部屋に 閉じ込めることだった

translation.en: ...for several days on end...
...forcing them to confront their own image.
translation.ja: 患者を鏡に映る自分と 対決させるの

translation.en: Dr. Kane was wrong about his theory.
translation.ja: でも先生の診断は 間違ってたわ

translation.en: There is no cure for schizophrenia, Mr. Carson.
translation.ja: 私の病気は 統合失調症ではなかった

translation.en: It was something else.
And whatever it was, it left me...
translation.ja: それは私の体から 抜け出して―

translation.en: ...and entered the mirrors.
Since that day...
...it has been collecting the souls of the people it kills.
translation.ja: 人を殺しては 死人の魂を集めてるの

translation.en: I'm sorry...
...but if I agree to go with you and return back to that place...
translation.ja: 私が同意して あの場所に戻ったら―

translation.en: ...I will make it possible for the demon to cross the threshold... ...back into the real world.
translation.ja: 悪魔が境界をまたいで 現実の世界に戻ってしまう

translation.en: Do you understand what that means for my family?
You can't do this, you need to come back with me.
I'm going to pray for you and your family.
translation.ja: ご家族のためにお祈りするわ

translation.en: That's all I can do right now, Mr. Carson. I'm sorry.
translation.ja: 今の私にできるのは それだけよ

translation.en: God bless you.
Gary Lewis, Terrence Berry, and many other men... ...have died trying to find you.
translation.ja: ルイスやベリーは あなたを捜せなくて死んだ

translation.en: And because they failed, their families died, too.
Two days ago, my sister was murdered.
My family will be next if you don't help me.
translation.ja: 次は妻子が標的にされる

translation.en: Please.
Please.
Wait, wait.
This is my family.
This is my wife Amy...
...and my daughter Daisy, and my son Michael.
They're beautiful.
They're innocent, they've never hurt anybody.
translation.ja: 人を傷つけたりしない

translation.en: Please.
Take the photo.
Just take the photo.
Look at them.
I'm sorry.
Who the hell do you think you are?
They're just kids!
-Hello? -Amy.
Ben, where are you?
At the monastery.
-Did you find her? -Yes.
Did you talk to....
-Amy? -Michael?
translation.ja: どうした？ マイケル

translation.en: Michael?
-Ben, hold on, Michael's gone. -What do you mean?
translation.ja: マイケルがいないの いない？

translation.en: I don't know, I fell asleep with the kids on the bed and now I don't know where he is.
translation.ja: 一緒に寝たのにいないの

translation.en: Amy, what's going on? Is everything all right?
translation.ja: エイミー　大丈夫か？

translation.en: Amy, what's going on? Have you got Michael?
Oh, my God.
Ben...
...there's water everywhere.
You've gotta be careful of the water. It creates reflections.
translation.ja: 気をつけろ　水は姿を映す

translation.en: Someone is in the house.
Someone scraped all the mirrors!
Amy, where is Michael?
I don't know. I don't see him anywhere.
You've gotta stay away from the water.
Get the kids and stay away from the water!
translation.ja: 子供らと水から離れろ

translation.en: -Michael? -Amy?
Amy?! Shit!
Which room is she in? Which one?
translation.ja: アンナは？　どこにいる？

translation.en: My family is not dying tonight. You are coming with me.
translation.ja: 家族を守る 一緒に来るんだ

translation.en: Michael?
Daisy?
Daisy, come here.
Come here, Daisy.
Mom?
Come here, sweetheart.
What are you doing in there?
Everything's gonna be all right.
Daisy!
Come here! Get down! Get down, right now!
Get down, sweetie. Get down. Oh, my God, are you okay?
Oh, my God! Stay right there, don't move, baby. Don't move.
translation.ja: そこにいて 動いちゃダメよ

translation.en: Mom, why did you do that to me?
It wasn't me, sweetheart. You know I would never hurt you.
translation.ja: あれは違うの ママじゃないわ

translation.en: Here. Hold this. Hold it tight.
Here, get down, sweetie. Let me see. Let me see.
translation.ja: ここに座って 傷を見せて

translation.en: Let me see, sweetie. It's gonna be okay.
translation.ja: 大丈夫　心配ないわ

translation.en: All right? I know it hurts, stay right there.
Give me your hand. I need you to hold it really tight, okay?
translation.ja: 手を出して ぎゅっと押さえるのよ

translation.en: Just flat and tight, just like that. Okay.
translation.ja: こう ぴったり当てて

translation.en: Now, I need you to listen to me, okay, baby?
translation.ja: ママの話をよく聞いて

translation.en: You have to be very brave. I need you to stay here no matter what happens.
translation.ja: 何があっても ここから出ちゃダメ

translation.en: No matter what you hear. Do not move from this closet until I come back.
translation.ja: ママが戻るまで じっとしてるの

translation.en: -You understand me, right? Okay. -Yes.
Do not move. I love you.
Don't move.
Michael?
Michael?
Where are you?
Michael!
Michael, what are you doing?
Don't be scared, Mommy. He just wants to play with us.
translation.ja: 怖がらないで 僕らと遊びたいだけだよ

translation.en: Michael, I want you to drop that knife, right now.
translation.ja: マイケル ナイフを捨てなさい

translation.en: Do you hear me?
You know very well you're not allowed to play with knives. Don't you?
translation.ja: ナイフで遊ぶのは 禁止のはずでしょ

translation.en: Come on.
That's a good boy.
Give me the knife, Michael.
Michael! Michael!
Why are you hiding from me, sweetheart?
Michael?
You okay? Come on.
It's waiting for me downstairs.
Bring me inside. From now on, I have to keep my eyes closed.
translation.ja: 連れてって 私は目を閉じてるから

translation.en: Step up. You're in the room.
translation.ja: 上がって　部屋に入った

translation.en: Strap me in.
I spent the darkest days of my life in this room.
translation.ja: 拷問のような日々だったわ

translation.en: Are you sure there's no other way?
This is for your family, Mr. Carson.
translation.ja: あなたのご家族のためよ

translation.en: For your family.
Michael?
Michael? Michael, look at me.
translation.ja: マイケル　ママを見て

translation.en: Michael!
Give him back to me!
No!
Please. Please.
You must go now.
Why?
Give him back!
Give him back! Give him back!
translation.ja: お願いだから息子を返して！

translation.en: Michael!
Anna!
Get away, you bitch!
Oh, my baby.
I love you.
I love you, guys.
